Reviews.Title: “The absolute Best stay”
Reviews.Author: leymone
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Suites is great...my family stayed here during spring break a couple of nights...it is incredible with customer service....ready to serve you or answer any questions that you may have for them. The rooms are lovely, and the best part is that there is no smoking!! We had so much fun in their indoor pool and hot tub, and even though i was on vacation i could still rise early and get my work out done with their well equip fitness center. We arrived early before check in time....they quickly provided us with a lovely room, might i add Hassle Free!!! there are no other words to describe this hotel but, Top of the Line. Thanks a lot Comfort suites I-240 East Airport your the Best at everything that you do!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: marykmiller
Reviews.Content: We called ahead to see if we could check in a hour early after driving 10 hours. The front desk said come on in our room would be ready. When we arrived it WAS NOT ready and we had to come back later. Our reserved room had a broken pull out bed, the carpet was dirty, the toilet seemed like at anytime it could be a danger zone!! I immediately went to the front desk to ask if there was another room available with a pull out bed that you could sleep on which at this point we were all totally exhausted from the long drive and just wanted to sleep. I had to upgrade to The Presidential Suite (I hope we haven't had any Presidents stay in this room because it would be an embarrassment). We had to literally go down to the front desk for pillows and blankets to the pull out bed because they DO NOT deliver them to you or keep extra in the rooms. I decided to walk down the stairs to the front desk for the items and talk about dirty. It seems this area has never been vacuumed or cleaned. Dirty, Dirty, Dirty. Even a gentlemen in the elevator on the way back up to the room said he was checking out after seeing his room and how dirty the hotel was. I was not compensated for having to change rooms due to the broken pull out couch, broken toilet, etc. in any way. This was suppose to be a four day getaway with my daughter and future son in law to show them Memphis. I was embarrassed to have them stay with us in this hotel and should have check out. I had already made all my reservations, unloaded all our bags and just thought we were too too tired to go to some other hotel. Too bad their Memphis memory was taunted the first day of arrival!!! DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still Great...”
Reviews.Author: ray s
Reviews.Content: Was back in Memphis and HAD to come back to "THE" only place I want to stay... This Comfort Suites is great... Same Faces as last Oct. So I felt at home. They even gave me my same room . NO SMOKING here so I get a room near a door. I ALWAYS have a Great Stay and will see them on my next trip into or through Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very good stay”
Reviews.Author: James K
Reviews.Content: In town for work. Stayed a month. Good breakfasts, friendly staff. Renovations underway. All good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jacksonlove
Reviews.Content: Had good time staying at your hotel, had to park my car there and your staff took good care of me. oh an the breakfast was great. Me and the family can't wait to come back to Memphis, the kids really enjoyed the indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Robert D
Reviews.Content: breakfeast was great, staff friendly and helpfull, loved the swimming pool and hot tub. High definition flat screen was a real nice plus. great stay

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE! FILTHY!”
Reviews.Author: DaFinn
Reviews.Content: I have traveled for over 30 years now so please take my advice. When we saw the room we were given (and then two more after that) we could not find one clean decent one, so we left. I was told by another Comfort Inn & Suites nearby that I-240 East Airport property had lost their flag and they are no longer part of the chain. That explains it. This place is VERY DIRTY! They are no longer taking care of this place. The carpeting is filthy (go look at the 2nd floor hall carpeting before checking in and you will see for yourself). The furniture I saw in the room was badly stained, some of the window heating/AC units had mold spewing from the vents and some of the mattresses were badly stained. The front desk clerk was very rude when confronted about the condition of the rooms. Hey if you want to party here, no problem. The rooms are big and they won't even notice the vomit stains you leave behind because there are so many others here already.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: mother15
Reviews.Content: JMJ If you like things crawling under your mattress and a staff who is clueless-this is your kind of place!! Someone needs to go in and retrain the whole staff. I'm still waiting to get some satisfaction after a horrible attempt to stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “â€œGreat place for business or pleasure in Memphis.â€�”
Reviews.Author: bart A
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel for the Price. Pillowtop Mattress Beds are wonderful I didn't want to get up. The rooms are very clean and spacious. Breakfast was good. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK For the Price”
Reviews.Author: really51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend of 11/18/11 for a soccer tournament nearby. Our whole soccer team stayed here & overall everyone seemed to like it for the price. The hotel is easy to find, right off the interstate & has plenty of dining options nearby. The staff was nice & check-in went very smoothly. The rooms are very big, great if you have kids. The rooms could have used a good scrubbing, but it was'nt too bad, just a bit dated maybe. The indoor pool area was nice, very clean. Breakfast was good & hot.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, comfortable hotel near airport and Interstate”
Reviews.Author: MSGYoungsville_NC
Reviews.Content: Comfort Suites on I-240 in Memphis is very convenient to the airport; in fact, with just three right turns from the hotel you can return a rental car at the airport. The suite had a front room with sofa and easy chair and a full kitchenette. The bedroom had ample space, and the separate vanity and bathroom were conveniently arranged, though a little snug. The bed and four pillows (noticeably not bouncy foam rubber) were comfortable. The suite had a HD flat screen television with a sharp picture. Everything was clean and in good order. Breakfast included a pretty good variety of breakfast foods; there were enough tables to accommodate everybody; and the breakfast area was well set up. When I went out the door of the room to go to breakfast, I found a Wall Street Journal in the door handle. The desk clerk recommended and provided printed directions and map to a seafood restaurant that was easy to find and had a varied menu and good food. Though the hotel sits close to the interstate highway, it was very quiet. I felt well served by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nicole B
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the breakfast was great. The rooms are very spacious, I will refer family and friends to this location. The staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Ok. Not anything special”
Reviews.Author: rtalley10
Reviews.Content: First room was smoked in, this is a smoke free hotel. Desk staff apoligized and moved us. Second door had to be slammed to lock. These are minor issues, but room was just ok. I can't complain, but as I stated it was just ok. Nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jesse-Sally
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Suites Thousand Oaks for three nights, 14-16 October 2011. The room was well maintained, and the breakfast was great. We have stayed at this motel numerous times over the years, and have never had any problems. A flat-screen tv was added since our last stay. We did not stay there during a Memphis visit last April after reading bad reviews on this website. However, this time we decided to give the motel another chance. We found the motel to be at the same high level of service and comfort that we have experienced previously. If you are looking for reasonably priced, comfortable accommodations, this is a great stay to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on business”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable and convienient place to stay on business. I spend about 120-140 nights each year in hotels, and I find this one suits my needs nicely. The rooms are always clean. Hotel staff is always willing to correct any minor problems that come up. The assortment at breakfast is much better than most hotels I've stayed at. Having eggs and breakfast meat is a real plus since I try to watch my carb intake.

Reviews.Title: “I'd DO IT Again at this Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: cliffsiler
Reviews.Content: A really great, comfortable place to stay! The rooms are huge and the pool is in an atrium so it was still open! An OK fitness center is available and the hot breakfast was good too. The internet seemed to work well and the TV had plenty of stations to choose from. The staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. There were a couple fast food places nearby but not close enough for a walk. There was even enough room to park our two semi trailers! A very pleasant choice for our one nights stay and I would definitely DO IT again at this Comfort Suites in Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: starknaked
Reviews.Content: The hotel room has mold growing in the bathroom, water marks on the ceiling, holes in the furniture that seems to have secured a TV or something, and staff that seems indifferent. The nice flat screen TV isn't secured, so could be tipped onto small kids. The breakfast offered no fruit at all, the waffle ran out of batter and when I told the care taker, she said she knew and walked away. And the wifi wasn't working.

Reviews.Title: “we had a great stay. I would recommendate to anyone...............”
Reviews.Author: Albert B
Reviews.Content: Staff were very nice. Hot Breakfast was awesome . I do not know why some other people wrote bad reviews. I was very pleased with our stay. I stay 50-60 nights per year with different hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Peabocoop
Reviews.Content: The indoor pool and the free breakfast was great. The staff was very efficient and were on the ball.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special...”
Reviews.Author: RainyGirl72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Was part of a large group. My family of four had to take a king room with pull-out sofa. The 'foot' of the sofa bed was broken. My 16yo daughter decided the floor was more comfortable than that. The second night we rented a second king room across the hall so that we could all sleep in a real bed. Both beds were a bit lumpy though. Breakfast was a little better than average. Scrambles eggs and biscuits. Ham or Sausage. Variety of pastries and bagels. Waffles and blueberry waffles. Hardboiled eggs. The staff had a very hard time keeping the buffet stocked though. Both mornings, I had to wait on coffee. The second morning, the tables were filthy and I asked for a cleaning cloth to clean my table and chairs before I allowed my family to sit down. In the meantime, the staff is working diligently on cleaning the waffle iron while people are standing in line for waffles. Something that should have waited until after 10AM and after the tables were wiped down for the next guests. The entire property was mediocre. I don't think I would stay here again - even for the discounted price.

Reviews.Title: “At least the truck drivers loved it...”
Reviews.Author: tthomp2
Reviews.Content: Well, the indoor pool WAS going to be the only thing good about the hotel until a woman with small children started smoking in the pool room while her offspring ran rampant. Then NOTHING was good about it. The room stinks, the floor feels wet in one place, the front desk person looked disheveled. I had to get an attitude with the van driver who chose to park DIRECTLY IN THE FRONT DOOR and didn't want to move it so we could get our stuff in the door. I haven't even gone to bed yet and frankly am afraid to because of the clientele. Maybe the coffee will be strong enough to keep me awake tomorrow. The only people I saw coming in were um...shady folks and random truck drivers. One person came in, looked at his room and IMMEDIATELY asked for a refund. I wish I had that option.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price of the room.”
Reviews.Author: cantrell30
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The room had bugs all over the window. We had 2 nights reserved and the 2nd night our keys didn't work. We needed more towels so w told front desk on the way to our room we saw housekeeping and he didn't want to give us any. They ran out of breakfast and it still had 30 mins left. People was still coming down. Don't waste your money. I only stayed here because of the jacuzzi tub.

Reviews.Title: “Ghetto hotel that smells like dirty buttcrack throughout the hotel including the room.”
Reviews.Author: bigber2003
Reviews.Content: This place has the most god awful smell in the rooms and hallways. It is in one of the ghettoest parts of memphis, not safe at all. The pool had probably about 60 little black kids in it and running around like hoodlums. The hot tub had about 4 inches of white foam on top of the water with hair grease all in it. No way were the chemicals right in them because you couldn't even see the bottom of the pool. The whole bottom floor had gangbangers running around everywhere with their little bandanas on. The hotel stank like dirty butt crack and I would not recommend this hotel to house your dogs in.

Reviews.Title: “Checked in and couldn't check out fast enough!”
Reviews.Author: Dixie3131
Reviews.Content: I used trip advisor to give my husband advise on the hotel Delta was sending them to with a room comp of $59. They had flight delays that made them miss their connecting flights. They met a couple going out with their luggage as they were arriving at night. They went to their rooms that smelled and it was all horrible. They all left and their shuttle took them to the Marriott who took their vouchers with no extra payment! They felt like they had left hell for heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: JennsTheWayISeeIt
Reviews.Content: When my husband returned from Iraq and we were returning to TX from block leave, we chose to stay in Memphis for a few days to visit with family. I LOVE Comfort Suites and was thrilled that this one allowed pets (for a fee of course) because we had the dog with us due to the length of travel. This Comfort Suites doesn't live up to the brand standard though. I was disappointed. On the plus side, there was a great breakfast and our nieces and nephew were able to visit us and use the indoor pool. The rooms being suites was a plus and I always love the extra space. This hotel isn't horrible, it just isn't impressive either. It doesn't live up to the standard I've experienced at other Comfort Suites. I'm sure there are better options in a city the size of Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: deb1953
Reviews.Content: Our flight to Minneapolis was diverted to Memphis on February 20, 2011, and Delta sent us to this hotel. It is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Every surface was sticky, there wre burm marks on all the tables and the bathroom vanity, and the carpet was disgusting. The bathroom hasn't been updated since the '80s and everything was either cracked or peeling. The final straw was the crack baggie that I found on the chair in the bedroom. I wish I'd stayed at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: SavyMaquire
Reviews.Content: I took my family to Memphis to see the sights. The Comfort Suites was quite a gem. It was a little chilly, so the kids enjoyed the indoor pool. Our suite was very spacious, and the extra room was really nice. We actually had two televisions. The staff was friendly and helpful. They were more than happy to give us directions to nearby attractions, and they even printed out maps. The free Internet was a big plus. Over all I would sat that Comfort Suites was a nice, "Choice."

Reviews.Title: “Bad Business All Over”
Reviews.Author: Inkedd
Reviews.Content: My family was coming down to visit me in Memphis because I attend college here and they planned their trip for a week or so, booked rooms in advance, paid for it on their credit cards - you wouldn't think there would be a problem so far. When we got to the hotel we were notified there would be a small "water problem" that they were fixing the pipes and everyone would be reimbursed for the trouble. This problem continued for the next four days of our stay so that my family and I couldn't have any down time in the hotel to watch films or play games and catch up on things without the threat the water would be shut off. The last day of our stay they actually shut the water off for nine hours while they expected my family to "just deal with it" as the manager told us. Thing is you pay for a vacation, ahead of time, and they screw you over with what was obviously a planned construction at the hotel for the week we were there - they just didn't want to lose business so they didn't tell anyone until it was already too late and had their bags unpacked. The management is atrocious - all we wanted was a partial refund because our stay was disrupted and an apology from the manager. What we got was one desk clerk after another pointing fingers at the assistant mangers who then typically pointed fingers at one and other while the two head managers pointed fingers at the bottom management. In the end they demanded that they did us a favor by allowing us to stay one day in the microtel because - excuse me - there was NO water service and we weren't notified until someone cowardly slipped a piece of paper under our hotel door. Trying to get an apology out of the leading manager was a waste. All the manager did was throw a tantrum like a 3 year old and provide failing logic. Her exact statement was "Well what can you do when YOUR water is turned off"?? I know what you can do - go to a hotel and expect ALL of the things you paid for aka water - are turned on! Talk about inhospitable hotels, horrible service, avoid this area like the plague or oral herpes, whichever one comes first.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: renabishop
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable and clean. The bed was just like home, so comfortable.The area was safe and secure. The employees were very pleasant, friendly, and helpful. If you needed directions or information they were more than willing to help. The complimentary breakfast was the best we'd ever had. Being a first time visitor to the city I worried about where we would stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual Comfort Suites quality-will do but that's all!”
Reviews.Author: nothappy0629
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that with a bit of work would be much better. Stayed for 3 days but had a dollar store plastic garden chair instead of a handicap shower chair, had no soap dish in the shower, no method of securing the shower head, and the floor flooded with use of the shower. All of these conditions require quite easy and inexpensive fixes but it appears they don't care. Many instances of deferred maintenance including old construction materials standing beside one entrance door-just looks bad and allows bugs to accumulate. My husband killed 2 small bugs in our bed the first night, they moved us to another room but I found a bug there and in the dining room. Just poorly kept!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel547
Reviews.Content: Our room was so filthy that we asked for another room. It was also filthy. One corner by the bed looked like someone had urinated on the wall. The door casing was half painted with brown paint, the couch was very old and in terrible shape. The pullout couch mattress was horrible and we could not imagine putting our children on such a filthy bed. There were cracker crumbs in the couch. This room looked like it was last updated in 1970. We were exhausted and the three children needed to be in bed. However, I knew that not one of us would get any sleep. I told my family that I would recommend that we all sleep in our clothes and shoes....walking on the floor barefoot didn't seem like a good idea. This was probably the most unpleasant experience I have had with a hotel room. We were not charged for the room and the night attendant was apologetic and said that no one had ever mentioned having difficulty with housekeeping before. I find this difficult to believe!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Diesel_BLMC
Reviews.Content: Place was clean, rooms where nice and staff was good. Our M\C club will be glad to return. Out of the hustle and bustle by being at the end of the road.

Reviews.Title: “Whirlpool Suite - very nice visit”
Reviews.Author: memphisvisitor
Reviews.Content: - We stayed in a nice whirlpool suite. - We had a doctor's appointed in town, so we appreciated the nice and quiet night. - Very good free breakfast - Comfortable beds - Very spacious room - Nice lobby area - Very nice front desk folks

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: tnik41
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable rates($59) for a very good hotel stay. 15-20 minutes from downtown is only drawback. Breakfast was just right. Probably saved us $60 from eating out. One morning I had a dead battery in my car and what seemed like the entire hotel staff came to my assistance! They treated the problem as if it were their own car. Can't thank them enough. They had a shuttle van that was available to transport guests around the area. The staff recommendations on restaurants, directions etc. were helpful and good. Each day the room was cleaned and neat upon return. Really no complaints whatsoever. Thank you Comfort Suites 2575 Thousand Oaks, Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Close to beale St for the price”
Reviews.Author: tomfish401
Reviews.Content: I live near St Louis, Mo, we are really not picky people, my parents were visiting from florida for a few days so we made a trip to memphis to see Beale st and try some of the BBQ. I made my reservations thru expedia. When we arrived the rooms that we were promised were not available. Terry the sales manager gave us what we thought was the hookup. (she was very nice) We had an executive suite each, which was like staying in a large motel 6 room. The hotel was very old, you could tell. My wifes mother went with us and stayed in the suite with my wife and i. When we went to bed the first night we closed the pocket door between the room and the living room, the next morning my wife got up to use the rest room and couldnt open the door. I had to get up and lift the door while sliding it back. (it was off the track) we reported it and was told that the owner knows about it but wont fix it, and the same problem was in my parents suite. First of all i would never pay the asking price for those rooms that they charge. I would have gotten my money back if i had. The TV looked like it was about to go out, it was real dark. I picked this hotel because of the price and the close proximity to Beale St. The breakfast was what i expected, it was good for being free with the room. My wife loved the indoor pool, her and her mom enjoyed swimming in it. I can see that they are slowly trying to fix it up, but until they get the rooms done it should be really discounted for anyone who wants to stay there. Its in bad need of updating. The carpet, the walls, the AC system, the televisions. I would stay there again, only because the closer you get to Beale St the more expensive it gets. For the price we paid it was worth someplace to lay your head and sleep. We spent most of our time away from the hotel, and it was at least clean, just old and dated. The bed was real comfortable. I would recommend this hotel only if you can get the rooms for a discount. Its only about 10 mins from Beale St.

Reviews.Title: “Very strong chemical smell......unbearable smell!”
Reviews.Author: roadtripperMoncton
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and the location was really convenient for our trip to Graceland. The room had THE most unbearable smell. Something was used to mask another smell and whatever they used was extremely strong. It was also very run down and dirty

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff needs to be more attentive”
Reviews.Author: mistyAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I was inn town to visit a friend for the weekend. Hotel elevator need to be cleaned. I was given a handicap room for some reason. The bathroom was not clean. The floor had someone else urine on it. There was someone else hair left in the hair dryer and the bathtub did not drain properly. I stayed two nights. I notified the front desk after the first night. When I arrived back at the hotel from being out the room and bathroom had been cleaned by the bathtub still did not drain properly.

Reviews.Title: “Business travelers will be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: businesstrav1
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty loyal to Choice Hotels, but won't come back to this one. Layout and furnishings are ok but a bit on the outdated and worn side. TV remote had no battery cover and worked only sporadically. The hairdryer only stayed on if I kept my finger on the button so had to dry one handed. I reported when I left for the day and they said they'd take care of it, but it was still like that when I returned at 5 so I called. They said then they'd send a new one up, which was almost 2 hours ago and no dryer. The upper hall smells like incense, and they had 2 tour busfuls of families so the breakfast room was a crowded nightmare this morning. Families may appreciate the value and the suite-style rooms, but even a budget conscious traveler can do better. Area has a few fast food joints, but no real restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very well pleased”
Reviews.Author: DickMetzgar
Reviews.Content: We are here for 5 days celbrating our 50th Wed. Anv. Extramly pleased with the folks who work here, esp Ricky Shah who has been most helpful and friendly. Would clearly stay here again if we were to return to Memphis!. We intially came for one day, extended to four, and then added another day.

Reviews.Title: “Made Our Anniversary Special”
Reviews.Author: drifter58
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife live in Memphis and just wanted to get a nice room with a jacuzzi and enjoy our 9th anniversary. We could not have picked a better place to stay. The rooms were nice and felt clean. The jacuzzi was clean and very nice. Beds were very nice and soft. We had a good time. The staff were very nice and friendly. We look forward to out 10th. Way to go Comfort Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: farmergirl38
Reviews.Content: On our way back north we went out of our way to stay at this hotel because it offered a room with 2 beds and a sleeper sofa, an indoor pool and free hot breakfast. We were sorry we did, because the room was stale from smoke and the pool did not open early enough for us to use it before we had to leave at 10:00 a.m. The pool and fitness room hours are 10a.m. to 10p.m.. Although this hotel has a policy to be 100% smoke free, it is not. Throughout the evening and in the morning we could smell fresh cigarette smoke coming out of a room and into the hallway. Our room had a faint stale smoke odor that got worse during the night after I turned the heat on. I believe the smell came from the curtains becuase they smelled like cigarette smoke and are right over the heater. I asked staff if this hotel used to have smoking rooms they said yes, so I may have had a former smoking room. More gripes; the sleeper sofa did not have bedding - I had to go to the front desk to get sheets and make the bed. The sofa mattress was worn out, lumpy, and had stains & crumbs on it. The general condition of the room was substandard, there were a lot of patches on the wall that were left unfinished, some baseboard trim was missing, light bulbs by the bed were burned out, a few spots of food on the wall by the sink, smudged up wall by the sofa and mold in the shower. The neighborhood was lacking in a choice of restaurants, there is a Chinese buffet and an IHOP, and a few fast food places. Go any further away from the highway and the place looks rough. We slept sound, even though it was New Years Eve and one would expect to hear something, we did not hear any loud noises. The room was very spacious. The breakfast was o.k., but no waffle mix available eventhough there was a waffle maker. The breakfast area was large with plenty of tables.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: cootsChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and the room was clean. Only problem was the pool. The pool filtration was not working and the pool had debris floating on top that looked disgusting. Otherwise the breakfast buffet was good and I would stay again . . . .

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably nice for the low price!”
Reviews.Author: eddiesgirlkym
Reviews.Content: We had six people with us and were surprised to discover that all hotels in our price range only accepted four to a room...until we found the Comfort Suites that is...the price was less than most of the other ones and slept six. We were expecting one room with two doubles and a sleeper. We were wonderfully surprised to find a two room suite, a separate room with two queen beds and a nice big tv in each room. There was a table and chairs, a kitchenette, a living area with a pullout sleeper, a good sized bathroom with wonderful shower, the kind with the bowed shower rod that gives you so much more space, and plenty of room to move! The room was clean and the staff was very helpful. The indoor pool is very small but so what, there is a hottub that makes it okay. The hot breakfast was better than most restaurant buffets. I really loved it and the only negative thing I can say is that the bubbles didn't work in the hottub...big deal! Oh, and the beds have a super plush comfy topper that you just sink into! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “dump and smelled bad”
Reviews.Author: darlaw
Reviews.Content: I am not a harsh reviewer. Most places I can make do, but this one needs this review. We did just pick up one of the discount travel books. This hotel had an indoor pool, so my child wanted to stay here. What a dump!! It became a joke that we would take her back there if she did not behave. The free internet was great. The breakfast was good- just don't look through the door where they make it! The mattress in the room was good, but I felt like my body was itching all night. The swimming pool was WAY too crowded. Way too small, and way too hot. You could not breathe. After having to stay here we did not even get to swim. Plus it opens too late in the AM. The shower curtain had this black mold on it. It was really gross. When we took a shower we put the curtain out of the tub and placed towels on the floor. I was not letting that curtain touch me. Lastly, I kept my shoes on the whole time I was in the room. It is really gross when you take a shower and your feet are black! And the room was arranged in a really weird set-up. Next time we will bypass on the pool, and just stay at something that looks nicer. This is one hotel I would have left, if it was not so late when we got there. Also, I don't feel I was charged the discounted price!

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Travel2708
Reviews.Content: The room smelled musty and the air didn't work well, the front desk made us feel like we were bothering them when we would speak to them, the indoor pool was heated but small and crowded, the couch and sleeper sofa in the room had stains and were very worn, the key cards had to be reset because "they just sometimes don't work", I made the reservation for 2 nights and they only scheduled us for one. The only hotel employee that was friendly was the housekeeper, and we ended our stay early because of how uncomfortable we were with the location and staff at this Comfort Suites. We were charged 4 times for a 2 night stay and when we called the hotel we were told the extra charges should fall off the account "in a few days" that someone was probably being trained using my account. I would not recommend this hotel for anyone. This hotel did not have room service and if you don't like pizza be prepared to find a dinning establishment on your own. This was our first vacation in a couple of years and it ended because of this Comfort Suites staff. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “More Like Comfort Ghetto - so PLEASE beware”
Reviews.Author: pstrygdess
Reviews.Content: My employees and I stayed at the comfort suites the last week in April of 2008. Comfort Suites has a very good reputation and we got a pretty decent deal on my 6 rooms. After one day of being there and once the weekend came, the hotel took a turn for the worse. There were prostitues soliciting guests to partake in activities (future hint, they keep the room doors cracked open, just walk in). I had 2 boys approach me to purchase drugs in front of management in the lobby. Did management do anything? NOPE. He just turned to the gangbangers looking for a room, gave them a much higher rate for the room and they had to pay cash. And then the worse. Our vehicle got broken into, not once, but twice. Since I was travelling with a trailer, I was only allowed to park in one place. The back of the building closest to Perkins Road. I wonder why? because that security camera is inoperable. Inside job you would think and I would have to agree. Both times, the break in happened within 1/2 hour of arriving to the hotel in pure daylight. Management refused to help and then sent maintenance to yell at us clearly saying "Welcome to Memphis." They refused to speak to the police. The other managers in the building had NO idea what happened and the owner? Who knows where he is. I dont know what kind of hotel these people are running. Stay away from this place and as the police said, go as far east as you can.

Reviews.Title: “Poor management”
Reviews.Author: Midwesternmember
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not live up to Comfort Suites expectations. We stayed in a two room suite. The hallways smelled of rotten garbage and cigarette smoke - even though the hotel is suppose to be 100% smoke free. There was a loud party across the hallway from us that we complained about and management didn't do anything about it. The rooms are a little outdated and need a thorough cleaning - mold in bathroom, stains on couch and floor. The breakfast was adequate. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, Loud, Loud”
Reviews.Author: HAL101
Reviews.Content: More noise than I have ever had to endure at a hotel, after the third call to security at one in the morning, I was finally able to fall asleep. I would not stay there again. The rooms were average at best, noticed some black mold in the bathroom, the room keys would work for a while but I would have to get new ones made every day. Machines in the guest laundry are old and don't work very well. If you are in a large vehicle, don't even think about getting into their parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed at much better comfort suites hotels...”
Reviews.Author: dorism
Reviews.Content: During a recent road trip from Dallas to Canada we stayed mostly at Comfort Inns/Suites. While most of them ranged from acceptable to good, the Memphis one was the worst. During our one night stay, two cars were broken into (where we personally witnessed the upset owners, for all we know there may have been more) and judging by the uncaring demeanor of the front desk staff, that appeared to be not an uncommon occurrence. The rooms were not very clean, the floor in the room so uneven, I was worried we may fall through! Did not use the pool for fear of it not being clean. Breakfast next morning terrible - they ran out of everything 45 Minutes early and did not replenish anything, they just told us they ran out!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Huldah
Reviews.Content: I like Comfort Suites overall because they are non-smoking. I stayed in a new, really lovely Comfort Suites recently, so I expected this of the Memphis location also, but it was a disappointment . The breakfast was good, nice thick towels, granite bathroom countertop, newer carpet, and the bed comfortable, but the room smelled funny and was beaten up looking with old furniture, beaten up walls, doors, and cracked shower stall wall. So, it's a mixed bag-some good and some not so good. But the price was fairly reasonable for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cherylCanada
Reviews.Content: After a 16 hr drive the lady at the desk seemed annoyed we arrived. She did not seem friendly at all. Our room smelled and the sofa bed had dirty rumpled sheets on it. I asked for new sheets which they gave me but I had to make the sofa bed myself for my son. I requested a new room the next day they were not happy but did grant my request due to the foul smell in the room (it smelled mouldy) The next room was alot better. The continental breakfast was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: 87Fiero
Reviews.Content: We had a king suite with a partial wall. The bed was very comfortable . The room was clean and furnishings in good condition. I appreciated having a refrigerator with a freezer but didn't use the microwave. The temperature outside was between 100 and 107 the 3 days we were in Memphis, so we were happy to have an air conditioner in good working order. I'm not fond of the separate dressing area- bathroom arrangement, but I know many people prefer it. The hotel is next to the freeway. We did not notice any freeway noise, but our friends on the same side of the hotel in the next room did notice the noise. If that bothers you, request a room on the side of the hotel away from the freeway. We enjoyed our stay, have no complaints, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “over-rated, over-priced”
Reviews.Author: rainey1
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Memphis to visit relatives, I stayed at this Comfort suites becuase my usual hotel (Drury Inn Sycamore View) was booked because of Memphis in May's last weekend. This hotel was double what I usually pay at the Drury, with supposedly the same amenities. After a long drive, I was too tired to check out after seeing the condition of the rooms. When I tried to find other accommodations in the morning, I couldn't so we had to stay anyway. I went to a local walmart and bought cleaning supplies myself and scoured the room myself just so that it would be clean enough to actually stay in. I also made sure that my family kept their socks on at all times because the carpet was absolutely filthy. The only good things I can say about this hotel is that the rooms were huge and spacious with two tvs so that the kids could watch thier shows and we could watch the news, the night desk clerk was accommodating and professional, and the breakfast was extensive and edible. If you don't mind cleaning your own room, don't mind ants all over the beds and nightstand, don't mind overlooking mysterious stains that look like dried blood on the floors and, yes, even on the walls, and you don't mind paying $120 a night for these things, then this is the hotel for you. Personally, it's not the hotel for me.

Reviews.Title: “Wait To Go Until Remodeling Is Done!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nana&Boppa
Reviews.Content: The room is huge and there is a microwave and refrigerator as well as the 2 TV's and a VCR. There is a table with chairs as well as a couch and recliner. BUT - the room was very dirty. We had to wait to check in as the rooms were still being cleaned at check in time. The furniture and carpet was very worn and stained (we put towels on the chairs before we sat on them). The floor had not been vacuumed and there was food on the floor and hairs in the bathroom as well as a moldy shower curtain. I complained to the manager and he said he would send the cleaning lady right in. I could hear her yelling out in the hall and she hadn't shown up after an hour so we left to go to Beale Street. She never did come back. The breakfast was one of the better ones we had with eggs and biscuits and gravy. The front desk was very nice and did take $10 off the bill but the manager was not around in the morning. They are in the process of remodeling the motel and hopefully getting a new cleaning lady!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so COMFORTable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were roomy and clean, but the tv cable connection was not very good...it was fuzzy. The night shift was asleep when we arrived and my husband kept clearing his throat to wake the gentleman up. When we went to get the complimentary breakfast there was none because they didn't have any warmers working, and our vehicle was broken into during the night with some valuables stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocrity in all aspects.”
Reviews.Author: TexasTwoStep
Reviews.Content: We go to Memphis for the Beale Street Music Festival every year. Area hotels usually have plenty of space. Not in 2005, as a number of other events were also scheduled for the same weekend. Our normal hotel and nearby neighbors were booked, so we ended up here. The best thing to say about this hotel is mediocrity rules. Nothing was terrible, but nothing great either. The "managers reception" was soda, beer, and chips. The rooms were minimally clean, the breakfast minimally edible, etc.. If you are like us and need a place to stay on short notice for 1-2 nights, this is ok. Any other stay is worth securing reservations at another hotel in advance. See attached photos.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Comfort Suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Suites for a short vacation. The room was very large and accomodated my family very well (2 adults and 2 children). It provided amenities such as microwave, refrigerator, VCR that we enjoyed especially since we had children with us. However, the Comfort Suites seemed to be old and worn and seemed to have a sort of stale odor that is in older buildings. Also the towel rack beside the sink was loose and needed to be tighten. I recommend the Comfort Suites if you need a reasonable priced room with extra space for a short stay, otherwise I would probably stay in hotel that was a little more updated and not quite as worn.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Suites I-240 East-Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 2575 Thousand Oaks Cove, Memphis, TN 38118
